intro: Heeria hypoleuca, commonly known as the white heeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Heeria hypoleuca is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
